column5: Hi all,  Finally got out on the ice, it was around -28C, lucky there was no wind.      Arrived at around 2:30pm           Put only one on the ice and missed a whole bunch            Froze our behinds off till the bitter end, would do it again in a heartbeat!        The slush out there was horrendous….REALLY BAD….my buddy got stuck before we had wet a line. Missed a couple of big ones….and littler ones…..line freeze/stuck bail arms/bad luck etc…etc..   Got stopped by a CO on the way out, good guy named Colin, he had a hard time believing we only had 1 fish to take home, but he knows us pretty well and took our word for it without searching (probably to cold to be bothered more like…lol).  Never been that much of a fan of walleye fishing in the winter, but was awesome to get out after almost 4 weeks of elbow rehab!!!!   Tight lines all.
No hut?,you guys are troopers!!!!!.Good to hear your arm is getting better.
You missed hook ups? Guess yer a bit out of practice.LOL  BURRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRR
Lucky duck you. Im jelous, nice report man.

nice report. damned that's cold Thanks man…not able to put a beating on them like your crappie….but was good fun even though it was ridiculously chilly. Getting old i think.  No hut?,you guys are troopers!!!!!.Good to hear your arm is getting better. Yup it was chilly, did not seem that cold out  until about 2pm, even before the sun had dropped too far it was brass monkeys out there.  You missed hook ups? Guess yer a bit out of practice.LOL  BURRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRR LOL…thats a good excuse…i'll use that.  Lucky duck you. Im jelous, nice report man. Thanks Pidge…needs to warm up a bit.  Nice how's your jiggin arm? Actually my jigging arm is fine…..jig with my right arm….its my left elbow. Works good to just reel with my arm extended pointing at the hole
Slush sucks. Glad your getting some jig-rehab for that elbow. Walleye fishing is never what the doctor orders, but what does he know? haha.

..for sure Rob and that Limey knows it! I can't stand being downtown Toronto in -6c and a breeze, but am right at home at -30C in Temagami.  Great stuff Simon.. don't be screwing that elbow up so early in the season my friend !
Absolutely.  That's a wet cold for ya.
your'e killin me !!! cant wait for Jan 1st  better get that arm fixed in time to battle some saltwater beasties !!!

your'e killin me !!! cant wait for Jan 1st  better get that arm fixed in time to battle some saltwater beasties !!!   I'm sure the +30C temps and standing eating mangoes waist deep in the clear, warm sea will work wonders for my rehab….cant wait!!!
